metadata.Title: CVE-2022-21245 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Security: Privileges). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.36 and prior and 8.0.27 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.3 (Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mariadb-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mysql-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
